page.title: 02THE HAMLET OF AISBY.
page.content: This hamlet,linked to the village of Oasby in the block to the north,has about 60 inhabitants.It has become quite an expensive rural residential area with former farmhouses and farm cottages enlarged and modernised and with some large private modern houses. Even so the hamlet still presents a pleasant rural appearance with its buildings grouped round 2 large open grassed areas.The hamlet lies on the east edge of the former Oasby Cow Common which is now used as the Oasby Village Cricket Ground.Only 1 farmer still lives and works in Aisby and all other workers work outside the block. All education takes place outside the block in the neighbouring market town of Sleaford.There are no amenities except post box and telephone.
